text.section: A person is guilty of burglary in the second degree when, with the intent to commit a crime, he knowingly enters or remains unlawfully in a dwelling.
Burglary in the second degree is a Class C felony.

law.history: Amended 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 376, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1980. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 125, sec. 2, effective June 17, 1978. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 98, effective January 1, 1975.
